metadata.title: CVE-2019-14553 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - negligible.
metadata.description:
Improper authentication in EDK II may allow a privileged user to potentially enable information disclosure via network access.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-14553` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ovmf - 0~20191122.bd85bf54-1ubuntu1
ovmf-ia32 - 0~20191122.bd85bf54-1ubuntu1
qemu-efi - 0~20191122.bd85bf54-1ubuntu1
qemu-efi-aarch64 - 0~20191122.bd85bf54-1ubuntu1
qemu-efi-arm - 0~20191122.bd85bf54-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.note: mdeslaur> Ubuntu packages aren't built with TLS_ENABLE, so HTTPS isn't enabled.

criterions.comment: edk2 package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0~20191122.bd85bf54-1ubuntu1').
